alert.note: Alert for Charleston; Coastal Colleton (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued September 30 at 1:03AM EDT until September 30 at 11:00AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM TO 11 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Up to one foot of inundation above ground level expected along shorelines and tidal waterways (7.8 to 8.0 feet Mean Lower Low Water at Charleston). * WHERE...Coastal Colleton and Charleston Counties. * WHEN...From 7 AM to 11 AM EDT this morning. * IMPACTS...This will result in some roads becoming impassable and minor flooding of properties. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...High tide will occur around 9:15 AM today at Charleston. Saltwater inundation will be possible 1 to 2 hours before and after high tide. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Charleston Harbor SC MLLW Categories - Minor 7.0 ft, Moderate 7.5 ft, Major 8.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.2 ft, Moderate 1.7 ft, Major 2.2 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 30/09 AM 7.9 2.1 1.0 N/A Moderate 30/10 PM 7.4 1.6 1.0 N/A Minor 01/10 AM 7.9 2.1 1.0 N/A Moderate 01/11 PM 7.4 1.6 1.4 N/A Minor 02/11 AM 8.1 2.3 1.3 N/A Major 02/11 PM 7.1 1.3 1.4 N/A Minor &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Visit water.weather.gov for additional water level and flood impact information.
